Subject: User agents and site customization

By default Heritrix uses the user-agent string

os-heritrix/0.10.0 (+PROJECT_URL_HERE)

Does anyone have an idea of how many pages might be missed by
misguided web masters refusing to return content because the user
agent isn't IE or Mozilla (et al.)?

Yahoo!'s crawler identifies itself with

Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Yahoo! Slurp; http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/ysearch/slurp)

And Google recently changed to

Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Googlebot/2.1; +http://www.google.com/bot.html)

because

   The primary reason for this is that some web servers assume that
   unless a user agent is IE, Netscape/Mozilla, or maybe Opera, that
   your browser won't support JavaScript, frames, etc. As Googlebot
   gets better over time, it gets closer to a regular user and browser
   in our ability to handle features like that. This user-agent change
   would let vanilla webservers assume Googlebot is more like a
   regular user, while still allowing site owners to recognize that
   Google is visiting and still providing clear contact info in case
   of questions or issues."

(GoogleGuy post on http://www.webmasterworld.com/forum3/22408-3-10.htm)

TIA,

    -tree
